DOC.brief_title: Assessing Patient Care Through Routine Use Patient-Reported Outcomes
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . Purpose : We use EQ5D Falls Prevention Clinic part routine clinical assessment baseline , 6-months 12-months track patient care cohort 300 old adult high-risk fall . 2 . Objectives : O1 : Our primary objective use routinely administer patient report outcomes measure , EuroQol-5D ( EQ-5D ) , old adult high risk fall determine patient self-reported health status 12-month followup period . O2 : Our secondary objective develop explanatory model predictive model covariates explain significant gain loss health relate quality life .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Referred fall clinic assessment general practitioner emergency department physician . 2 . Index fall presentation due overwhelm force result presentation Emergency Department general practitioner ( include syncopal presentation , see ) . 3 . At least 70 year age . 4 . No progressive neurological disorder ( e.g . Dementia , Parkinson 's , Alzheimer 's ) . 5 . Community dwelling ( within Vancouver Burnaby ) . 6 . Mini Mental State Examination Score least 24 . 7 . Walk least 3 meter . 8 . Has least one follow 'highrisk ' criterion : At least one nonsyncopal fall past 12 month PPA least 1.0 ( use dominant score strength test ) TUG least 15 second 9 . Life expectancy great 12 month determine geriatrician . 1 . Any patient meet inclusion criterion specify excluded assessment Falls Prevention Clinic .
